solution_line_template: First find the total number of tools in the Walmart multitool: {walmart_screwdriver} tool + {walmart_knives} tools + {walmart_other_tools} tools = <<{walmart_screwdriver}+{walmart_knives}+{walmart_other_tools}={walmart_total_tools}>>{walmart_total_tools} tools

Then find the total number of knives in the Target multitool: {walmart_knives} knives * {multiplier_for_target_knives} = <<{walmart_knives}*{multiplier_for_target_knives}={target_knives}>>{target_knives} knives

Then find the total number of tools in the Target multitool: {target_screwdriver} tool + {target_knives} tools + {target_files} tools + {target_scissors} tool = <<{target_screwdriver}+{target_knives}+{target_files}+{target_scissors}={target_total_tools}>>{target_total_tools} tools

Then subtract the number of tools in the Walmart multitool from the number in the Target multitool to find the difference: {target_total_tools} tools - {walmart_total_tools} tools = <<{target_total_tools}-{walmart_total_tools}={difference_in_tools}>>{difference_in_tools} tools
